page.title: 19Family Life-Christmas
page.content: Christmas in Alsager at the begining of the century was very different from the present commercialized scene. Then the nights were silent and the mere often frozen. Skaters and curlers thronged the ice. Mr. Band perched high in his cab drawn by two handsome chestnut horses made a traditional Christmas scene. The lamplighter could be seen doing his rounds with his long hooked pole and children pressed their faces against the candle-lit windows gazing at penny lucky buys, small toys and dolls. Christmas to-day has high media coverage. Advertisments are for our attention. The Christmas tree outside the library is lit with electric light bulbs. Shops decorated with artifical snow and plastic decorations bulge with electronic gadgets and expensive toys.
